title: Classic Wooden Toys
description: Before plastic took over, wooden toys were the treasures of childhood. How well do you remember these handcrafted classics?

questions.question: Fisher-Price's first toys, introduced in 1930, were primarily made from what material?
The Fisher-Price Snoopy Sniffer, a wooden pull-toy dog, was one of the company's most popular toys. What did it do when pulled?
options: Its ears flapped and it made a sniffing sound

questions.question: What classic wooden toy featured colored rings that stacked on a central peg, teaching children size order?
Wooden alphabet blocks have been a children's toy since what century?
What classic wooden toy consisted of a flat board with different shaped holes and matching wooden pieces?
Wooden rocking horses were a staple of childhood for centuries. What was the body of a high-quality rocking horse typically covered with?
The Jacob's Ladder, a classic wooden folk toy, creates what visual illusion?
options: Blocks appearing to tumble down like a cascade

questions.question: What wooden toy, popular in the 1940s-50s, featured a small wooden man who appeared to walk down an inclined board?
Wooden tops were spun by children using what method?
options: Winding a string around them and pulling it

questions.question: The wooden toy called a 'cup and ball' involved what skill?
options: Balancing a ball on a stick
Rolling a ball through a wooden maze
Catching a ball attached by string into a wooden cup

questions.question: Playskool, known for wooden educational toys, was founded in what decade?
What classic wooden toy allowed children to hammer colored pegs through holes in a bench?
Wooden wagons, like the Radio Flyer, were a childhood staple. The Radio Flyer company was founded by an immigrant from what country?
What was the name of the simple wooden toy that made a 'mooing' sound when turned upside down?
Wooden jigsaw puzzles were invented in the 1760s originally for what educational purpose?
